name: flyp
description:
From empty property to a home that sells. At flyp, we know how to make the right buyer fall in love. We transform empty properties so our homeowners can sell faster, for more. 

Our mission is to make every home sell for its fullest possible value. Using our unique business model, homeowners now have a genuinely ground-breaking way to sell their home. A flyp home is made to sell.

team.name: Jeremy Cortial
team.bioHtml: Founder @StayBeyond, @yellowpop • founded @DripApp, @Tornado

jobs.title: Furnitures and accessories buyer / Procurement manager
jobs.description:
WHO ARE WE 

We’re a startup that’s revolutionising the way homes are being sold. Our mission is to help homeowners unlock the full value potential of their home before they sell, so that when they do, they're not leaving any money on the table.

We help homes sell faster and for more by transforming them to appeal to a target buyer, and offer these transformations at no upfront cost to homeowners.

We’re able to offer every flyp at no upfront cost because our financial model uses short-let guests to generate income and pay down our investment. If the home sale exchanges quickly and we haven’t recouped our investment in full, a sliding scale fee is applied to the proceeds of sale that ensures the transformation costs are covered in full.

We’ve completed 35 flyps to date, and all have sold at or above their initial asking price after months on the market without any acceptable offers. Flyp homes complete in an average of 229 days, whilst the market average time to complete is currently 511 days.

We’re able to carry out flyps more efficiently and more cost-effectively than anyone else in the market, and demand generation for our short-let operation is maintained through our sister company StayBeyond, which has been operating for 5 years and has 150+ properties in 8 cities across the UK.

KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES:

A strong commercial acumen
Understanding the different buyer profiles and design associated to them
A keen eye for unique, innovative and attractive products
Capable of developing own brand product from concept to delivery
Ability to use initiative in all aspects of decision making


SUPPLIER MANAGEMENT:

Source, maintain and continue to develop a commercial supplier base across Own Brand and External Brands
Focus on relationship management to ensure suppliers can deliver the needs of the range and the business on time and to budget to our terms
Suggest new suppliers/brands that are relevant to our business

ADMINISTRATION

Maintain accurate and clear records of all suppliers, products, pricing and compliance reporting
Meet deadlines in particular range submission for approvals and sourcing/delivery deadlines 
Control budget and target prices for each type of items
Maintaining and updating ADS, pricing files and range packs
Following through on sourcing/delivery deadlines to ensure these meet our needs

COMMERCIAL

Agree the commercial terms for your remit with your buyer/suppliers and continually improve them
Negotiate payment terms and rebate schemes where appropriate
Ensure intake target price meets  the budgets set for each category or product type
Communicate the safety, legislative and shipping compliances required and ensure the supplier/manufacturer achieves the requirements

ESSENTIAL KEY SKILLS

Experience/knowledge of furniture and lighting
Manage, develop and motivate direct reports
A proven track record of networking, negotiation skills, including managing supplier relationships
Team player who is happy to ‘muck in’
Highly numerate with strong analytical skills
Excellent communication skills
Extremely well-organised, methodical and efficient, with the ability to self-motivate and drive initiative.
A sense of personal style and a keen eye for details

jobs.title: Interior Designer / Project Manager
jobs.description:
WHO ARE WE


We’re a startup that’s revolutionising the way homes are being sold. Our mission is to help homeowners unlock the full value potential of their home before they sell, so that when they do, they're not leaving any money on the table.


We help homes sell faster and for more by transforming them to appeal to a target buyer, and offer these transformations at no upfront cost to homeowners.


We’re able to offer every flyp at no upfront cost because our financial model uses short-let guests to generate income and pay down our investment. If the home sale exchanges quickly and we haven’t recouped our investment in full, a sliding scale fee is applied to the proceeds of sale that ensures the transformation costs are covered in full.


We’ve completed 35 flyps to date, and all have sold at or above their initial asking price after months on the market without any acceptable offers. Flyp homes complete in an average of 229 days, whilst the market average time to complete is currently 511 days.


We’re able to carry out flyps more efficiently and more cost-effectively than anyone else in the market, and demand generation for our short-let operation is maintained through our sister company StayBeyond, which has been operating for 5 years and has 150+ properties in 8 cities across the UK.



We are looking for a project manager / interior designer to join our team and help us with the transformation of our homes.


KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES


Develop original concepts, providing effective solutions to the create designs that match our buyer profiles.

Working closely with the procurement team and on boarding team to define the perfect selection of furnitures & accessories to match with those designs.

Project manage the day-to-day development and preparation of design schemes.

Creating all the collaterals necessary to onboard each property smoothly (selection of items, design plan, floor plan etc..)

Liaising with contractors, local authorities and consultant.

Ability to take projects through all stages


SKILLS & EXPERIENCE


Bachelors degree in Interior Architecture, Interior Design, Architecture.

Proven experience in homes interior design sector or hospitality sector. 

Exceptional understanding of the new trends of interior design and eager to learn how to design houses that sell.

A lot of creativity and innovativity around our product to create a unique and strong value proposition.

WOW effects needed in all our designs.

Confident in taking projects to site.

Communicate effectively with key team members and clients on a regular basis.

Able to manage timescale and consistently produce work of high standard.

Skilled in AutoCAD, Sketch-up and Adobe Suite is a big plus 


BENEFITS


Health and Life insurance

WeWork environment

Monthly team building event

Access to our network of properties for free
